Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • Link

  • public class Link
extends java.lang.Object
    A Link class that represents a link between two routers. It contains four packet queues, and in bound and out bound queue for each end. It also simulates the moving of packets from one end to the other end.

      • movePackets

        public void movePackets()
        If the link is up moves the packets from the out queue of one end to the in queue of the other end.

      • enqueuePackets

        public void enqueuePackets(int routerid,
                           Packet p)
        Places the Packet p, in the out bound queue for the router specified by router id.
        Parameters:
        routerid - the router whose out bound queue to place the packet in.
        p - the packet being sent.

      • dequeuePackets

        public Packet dequeuePackets(int routerid)
        Retreives a Packet, from the in bound queue for the router specified by router id. If no packet is present returns null.
        Parameters:
        routerid - the router whose in bound queue to remove the packet from.
        Returns:
        the packet being retrieved.

      • queueLength

        public int queueLength(int iface,
                       boolean inbound)
        Returns the queue length for a particular direction and end of the link.
        Parameters:
        iface - 0, 1 specifies the end.
        inbound - specifies whether in it the in or out queue.
        Returns:
        the length of the queue
